page.title: 12HOUSING IN N.BRISTOL
page.content: {Henbury:}17th-19th century houses around church now restored as flats,schools & large houses.To N.E. private detached & semis merge with council semis - now 20% privately owned-flats,maisonettes & a few high rise flats.{Westbury:}little of 8th century remains,but charming village of old houses grown into commercial centre & focus of area.Mainly private ownership with isolated clusters of council- owned ,most war-time pre- fabricated homes now demolished. {Southmead:}large council estate built in: 1). 1930's "Old Estate" south of Greystoke Avenue with high % of social problems. 2). 1940's "New Estate"to north, felt to be of higher status by its residents. 3). 1950's In-filling between north end of New Estate & Charlton Rd. Mixed private & council with maisonettes & O.A.P. homes.
